key_title: Key to the species of Derwentia

source.author: Briggs, B.G.; Makinson, R.O.
source.title: Derwentia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Briggs, B.G.; Makinson, R.O. (1999). Derwentia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves pinnately divided, often further divided or lobed
Leaves non-glaucous, not fused at base, margins with 30–80 pairs of apiculate teeth; flowers white or pale lilac or pale blue
Leaves stongly glaucous, at least some fused at base, margins entire, finely crenate or with up to c. 10 pairs of shallow or coarse acute teeth; flowers blue or purplish-blue
